title: Question 10
prompt:
Sentence 1: Thank you for the opportunity, to interview for the position of sales assistant at Carnival Toys.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The main uses of a comma are to separate items in a series, to set off an appositive, to separate an introductory phrase or clause from the main clause of the sentence, or to separate two independent clauses joined by a conjunction. “To interview” is an infinitive, which is the word to followed by a verb. It modifies the word opportunity, clarifying which opportunity the writer means. No comma is needed between a noun and an infinitive that modifies it.
Thank you for the opportunity to interview for the position of sales assistant at Carnival Toys.
